result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Andrew Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Phillip Andrew Larson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Phillip Andrew Larson was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "B" Felony], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per signed Stipulation and Order of the Court February 24, 2016 - amend JOC to 15 years Initial Confinement and 10 years Extended Supervision.

-Court dismisses Counts 2 through 6.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant to be evaluated at Dodge Correctional.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant ordered to pay for future counseling and/or self protection classes as requested.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 and Case #14CF294.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF294.
Not to use or possess firearms.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.M.C., A.M.S, B.A.O. or their families.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
-Defendant to have No Contact with anyone under 18 years of age without prior Agent approval.
-Defendant to cooperate with any recommended programming.
-Defendant to comply with Sex Offender registration requirements.
-Defendant to provide and pay for a DNA sample.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Carey, ADA: M Nieskes, DF ATTY:  P Rogosheske, DF: Phillip Andrew Larson appeared from jail.  Agent Sonnenberg present.  Court notes review of PSI on file and also private evaluation received this date from Atty Rogosheske.  Recommendations and victim impact statements made to the Court.  
Sentence: 45 yrs 0 mos; IC - 25 yrs 0 mos; 20 yrs 0 mos.  Credit for 123 days time served.  
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-  absolute sobriety:  zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.
- it is hereby ordered that defendant have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, AMC, AMS, BAO and/or their families.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.
- defendant to have no contact with anyone under 18 years of age without prior agent approval.
- defendant to cooperate with any recommended programming.
- defendant not to own or possess any firearms.
- defendant to comply with sex offender registration requirements.
- defendant to provide and pay for a DNA sample.
- defendant to pay costs of $268.00
- defendant ordered to pay restitution for future counseling and/or self protection classes as requested. 
Defendant to be evaluated at Dodge Correctional. 
Defendant advised of right to appeal.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Minot, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Paul Winslow Rogosheske   DF:  Phillip Andrew Larson appeared from jail. Case called at 10:59 am. ADA Nieskes recites agreement. No objection from Atty Rogosheske. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #1. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty. Court dismisses Counts #2 - 6. Court orders PSI.  Atty Rogosheske questions Def. Bail is revoked. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

per Defendant's bond. eif
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.M.C. dob 5/18/03, A.M.S. 2/24/2002 or B.A.O. dob 2/12/04.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Not to enter the state of Wisconsin unless for court proceedings.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
